item.title: Recent projects
item.description: Modeling the within host HIV infection included immune responses and the evolution of virus since viral load blows up and progress to AIDS.

item.title: About me
item.description: I am a second year masters student at the University of Victoria. I study mathematical biology under joint supervision of Prof. Junling Ma and Prof. Pauline van den Driessche. Research Interests: Mathematical Biology Contact Network Mathematical Modelling Infectious Disease Analysis Educational Backgroud: MSc. Mathematics - In progress BSc. Statistics - 2018 BSc. Financial Mathematics and Economics - 2018 Contact: xiexinqi at uvic.ca DTB 457, 3800 Finnerty Rd, Victoria, BC V8P 5C2 +1-250-472-5691
